text: Hi! I'm Rishabh, a final year Integrated Master's student of the Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, majoring in Math & Computing. My interests align in Computational and Bayesian Statistics, primarily in analysing and developing MCMC techniques, but not restricted to it. I used Julia as change of pace for doing my assignments for Non Linear Programming and I would like to contribute to any project aligned towards statistical computing. Maybe Turing.jl would be a good place to start? (Also, what kinds of projects are of current interests in the Julia community? I would like to work on the recent advances in coupling based MCMC techniques <https://arxiv.org/abs/1708.03625>)

attachments.title: Unbiased Markov chain Monte Carlo with couplings
attachments.text: Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods provide consistent of integrals as the number of iterations goes to infinity. MCMC estimators are generally biased after any fixed number of iterations. We...
attachments.fallback: arXiv.org: Unbiased Markov chain Monte Carlo with couplings

text: Cool. Would you like to join the <#CCYDC34A0|turing> channel? Some folks from the Turing team have recently worked on coupling based MCMC techniques and the paper is currently under review. cc: <@U6H9SJKCH>

text: Hi Rishabh, yes I was recently working on improving coupled HMC (based on <https://arxiv.org/abs/1709.00404>). The codebase is based on AdvancedHMC.jl; I haven’t made the code for couplings public but will do so when the paper is there. Happy to chat more if you are interested in.

attachments.title: Unbiased Hamiltonian Monte Carlo with couplings
attachments.text: We propose a methodology to parallelize Hamiltonian Monte Carlo estimators. Our approach constructs a pair of Hamiltonian Monte Carlo chains that are coupled in such a way that they meet exactly...
attachments.fallback: arXiv.org: Unbiased Hamiltonian Monte Carlo with couplings

text: Hi <@UC0SY9JFP>, <@U6H9SJKCH>! I have joined the <#CCYDC34A0|turing>  team here on slack. <@U6H9SJKCH> I am interested in working on this and would love to have a chat about it. In the meantime, I will look into the codebase to get familiar with the project. Thanks!
